xxl.core.pipes.operators.groupers
Class AbstractGrouper<I>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.operators.AbstractPipe<I,I>
          xxl.core.pipes.operators.identities.IdentityPipe<I>
              xxl.core.pipes.operators.groupers.AbstractGrouper<I>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Pipe<I,I>, Node, Sink<I>, Source<I>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
HashGrouper, PredicateGrouper
public abstract class AbstractGrouper<I>
extends IdentityPipe<I>

Abstract framework for the group-operation. A group operator consists of a singular pipe, where the elements stream in, and a group-function or -predicate is applied to them, which determines the group an element belongs to. A number of IdentityPipes are subscribed to this group-operator, each modelling an own group. If a sink wants to get elements from a group-operator, it has to subscribe to a special group, otherwise an exception is thrown to indicate that no group has been selected.
The groups can be referenced via the method getReferenceToGroup(groupNo). The method transfer maps an incoming element to its corresponding group(s). Thus, both methods are abstract because they depend on a group-operator's implementation.

Note: A group-operator performs only a partitioning, but no aggregation.

Since:
1.1
See Also:
AbstractGrouper.Group, HashGrouper, PredicateGrouper

Constructor Detail

AbstractGrouper

public AbstractGrouper()

AbstractGrouper

public AbstractGrouper(Source<? extends I> source,
                       int sourceID)
Helps to create a new group-operator as an internal component of a query graph.
The subscription to the specified source is fulfilled immediately.

Parameters:
source - This pipe gets subscribed to the specified source.
sourceID - This pipe uses the given ID for subscription.

                         int sourceID)

Subscribes the specified sink (group) with the given ID to this pipe.

unsubscribe

public boolean unsubscribe(Sink<? super I> sink,
                           int sourceID)
                    throws SourceIsClosedException
The given sink (group) cancels its subscription. The registered sink with the given ID will not be informed about new elements any longer.

Specified by:

Overrides:

ID - The ID of the sink whose subscription is to be cancelled.
Returns:

transfer

public abstract void transfer(I o)
Transfers the given element to its corresponding group(s).
The process method for each of these sinks is invoked with the element to be transferred and the ID the corresponding sink (group) initially specified during its subscription.
If the output rate is measured, the output counter is incremented by adding the number of process calls.

Specified by:
transfer in interface Source<I>
Overrides:
transfer in class AbstractPipe<I,I>
Parameters:
o - The element to be transferred.

getReferenceToGroup

                                                      throws IllegalArgumentException
Returns a reference to the group that corresponds to the specified group-number groupNo.

Parameters:
groupNo - The group-number.
Returns:
The group corresponding to the given group-number.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the specified group-number is not valid.
